abstract: In an interview, Mr. Lurie shared some of his thoughts about AT&T’s future and the state of the wireless industry and those “supercookies.”
snippet: In an interview, Mr. Lurie shared some of his thoughts about AT&T’s future and the state of the wireless industry and those “supercookies.”
lead_paragraph: AT&T recently appointed Glenn Lurie chief executive of its mobile business and moved Ralph de la Vega, the former mobile boss, into a broader role working with professional customers. The move, company watchers said, was driven by AT&T’s ambition to become the Internet connection in your home, office or even your car.

headline.main: A Conversation With Glenn Lurie, AT&T Mobility’s New Chief
